item.title: Switch 2 exclusive Kirby Air Riders has a release date and it's just three months away
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo is launching Kirby Air Riders exclusively for Nintendo Switch 2 on 20th November.

Nintendo has announced that Kirby Air Riders will release on 20th November. The game is an exclusive for the Nintendo Switch 2, and is a sort of follow-up to Kirby Air Ride, a GameCube game from 2003 that has gained a cult following in the years since. The new game is being developed by Bandai Namco and Sora.

The Air Riders release date news came during the special 45-minute Nintendo Direct focused on the game. Kirby Air Riders is directed by Masahiro Sakurai. If that name sounds familiar, it's probably because he was the director of Super Smash Bros. Ultimate on Switch, and he created Kirby.

The original Kirby Air Ride was notoriously not loved by everyone. Leading UK games magazine, Edge, awarded the game a less than positive 3/10 rating back in issue 127. IGN.com scored the game a similarly disappointing 5.2/10.

This is a news-in-brief story. This is part of our vision to bring you all the big news as part of a daily live report.

item.title: Helldivers 2 hits Xbox next week with a Halo-themed Warbond that's out on PlayStation and PC too
item.content:encoded:
Ahead of Helldivers 2's arrival on Xbox Series X/S next week, Arrowhead Game Studios has revealed a Halo-themed Legendary Warbond - featuring a range of familiar equipment - that's heading to PS5 and PC too.

Officially titled the Helldivers 2 x Halo: ODST Legendary Warbond (technically ODST stands for Orbital Drop Shock Troopers, but this is being jokingly reframed as Obedient Democracy Support Troopers in Helldivers 2), it launches alongside the game's Xbox release on 26th August.

Legendary Warbonds cost 1,500 Super Credits (which can be found in-game or purchased with real money) and contain rewards gradually unlocked by playing. The crucial bit, though, is that Warbonds aren't time-limited, meaning players can unlock everything at their own pace. Here's what's included in the Halo: ODST Legendary Warbond, as per today's announcement:

Helldivers 2 x Halo: ODST Weapons
  • MA5C Assault Rifle – An iconic rifle; the definition of reliable and having taken down countless aliens bent on wiping out humanity, it is time to turn its sights on enemies of Managed Democracy. It comes equipped with the convenient ammo counter and a built-in compass – let it guide you to victory.
  • M7S SMG – Silent and deadly, with caseless ammo and a non-removable suppressor; this weapon is ready to spread Freedom to every corner of the galaxy.
  • M90A Shotgun – This powerful shotgun carries a kick and has a handy flashlight mounted on it so you can see the fear in your enemies' eyes before you teach them a valuable lesson about Liberty.
  • M6C/SOCOM Pistol – They say keep your friends close and your sidearm closer. Well, we say that. The standard-issue ODST sidearm is your silent ally in the field – equipped with a built-in laser sight, flashlight, and, for the first time in Helldivers 2, a suppressor to support stealth gameplay. Because sometimes the best way to enforce Peace is quietly...
Helldivers 2 x Halo: ODST Armor
  • A-9 Helljumper – Debuted during the New Mombasa Armor Show, this sleek ensemble is sure to turn heads and blow minds.
  • A-35 Recon – Made famous by the Ministry of Intelligence's hide-and-seek-and-destroy champion of '52, this armor has been improved by removing excess shoulder protection.
  • Feet First Armor Passive – Applied to both the above armor sets, this passive allows your Helldiver Helljumper to make less noise when moving, become immune to leg injuries, and increases the range of discovering points of interest by 30 percent.
Helldivers 2 x Halo: ODST Capes and More
  • Honored Heirloom Cape – Should the wearer of this cape perish at the hands of Freedom’s enemies, it is customary to pass the cape on to their bravest child during the funeral, inspiring the next generation to take up arms.
  • Eye of the Clandestine Cape – Those who serve Liberty from the shadows often elect to stay anonymous, moving like traceless spectres through the night. May they watch over us always.
  • More! – The Warbond will also include ODST-themed player cards, a new player title, "Rookie", and new vehicle pattern in a very familiar color known as Mean Green.

item.title: Watch today's Kirby Air Riders Direct here
item.content:encoded:
It's been a busy couple of week in Nintendo presentation land. First we had that third-party-focused partner showcase, then it was the turn of the indies, leaving everyone to speculate that a proper Direct showcase much surely be on the way. And, well, here we are, sort of. Today's 45-minute Direct is apparently focused exclusively on Switch 2's upcoming Kirby Air Riders - and if that appeals, here's where you'll be able to watch it unfold.

Nintendo's Kirby Air Riders Direct officially gets underway today, 19th August, at 2pm BST. That's 3pm CEST for our European chums, and 6am PDT/9am EDT/7am MDT/8am CDT for anyone over in the US. And, yes, you did read that right earlier; Nintendo has confirmed we're in for a full 45 minutes focused entirely on Kirby Air Riders - which seems like a lot considering it managed to squeeze its Donkey Kong Bananza Direct into less than 18 minutes.

As you might expect, today's Kirby Air Riders Direct airs on YouTube and promises an "in-depth look" at the game, as presented by its director, the legendary Masahiro Sakurai - who also created its underrated 2003 predecessor Kirby Air Ride, alongside the considerably more fondly remembered Smash Bros. series.

And if you need a reminder, all we've seen of Kirby Air Riders so far is its announcement trailer from back in April, which you can watch below while we await today's full Direct reveal.
